Title_Parsed: Intern to serve in our Washington, DC office
Qualifications: gain as much experience as possible
feel connected to all staff and constituents they interact with
substantial knowledge of how a congressional office works
importance of the U.S. House of Representatives
Equal_Opportunity_Information: We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, military status, gender identity and expression, marital status, parental status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Responsibilities: assisting both legislative and communications stae
Qualifications: qualiﬁed individual with a passion for federal policy
students with experience in policy or government
exceptional written and oral communication skills
interest in public service (Washington state ties a plus)
Equal_Opportunity_Information: This office is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, religion, disability, age, ethnicity, national origin, sex, gender, LGBTQ identity, family status, or military status. Specifically targeting women, people of color, and traditional underrepresented groups.

Responsibilities: answering and logging constituent phone calls
Qualifications: being able to work in a fast-paced environment
having a general understanding of the legislative process
possessing strong written and oral communication skills
Equal_Opportunity_Information: We are an equal opportunity employer.
Cleaned_Text: The Oeice of Congressman Brian Mast (R-FL-21) is currently accepting applications for unpaid internships at the Washington, DC member oeice during the spring 2025 term. This internship will run from early February through May.*Responsibilities include answering and logging constituent phone calls, assisting stae with administrative duties, projects, legislative research, and drafting constituent correspondence.*The ideal candidate will be able to work in a fast-paced environment, have a general understanding of the legislative process, and possess strong written and oral communication skills. Florida ties are not necessary but preferred. The internship schedule is ﬂexible for college students if needed.*Interested applicants should email their resumes and a brief writing sample to joseph.harrington@mail.house.gov. Please use the subject line “LASTNAME - Spring 2025 internship.”

State_District: U.S. House Select Committee on Strategic Competition
Responsibilities: assisting Committee stae in preparing for congressional hearings
performing other policy and administrative tasks as necessary.
Qualifications: eager to join a fast-paced environment
strong organizational, communication, research and writing skills
able to manage multiple tasks and work well under pressure in a team environment
Equal_Opportunity_Information: We seek candidates with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
